H0.text: The liver is the organ in an animal that removes wastes from the blood, whereas the bladder's job is to store wastes.

H1.text: Heart is the organ in an animal that removes wastes from the blood, whereas the bladder’s job is to store wastes.

H2.text: Stomach is the organ in an animal that removes wastes from the blood.

H3.text: Kidney removes wastes from the blood in an animal, while the bladder stores those wastes.

A4.text: The kidneys excrete a variety of waste products produced by metabolism into the urine.

A5.text: The kidney participates in the control of the volume of various body fluids, fluid osmolality, acid–base balance, various electrolyte concentrations, and removal of toxins.
